news_header: Fuel prices in Nigeria have surged fivefold since last year, leading to a tragic explosion that killed at least 140 people.
news_text: Despite having large oil reserves, Nigeria has experienced a significant rise in fuel prices, which have increased five times since last year. A recent explosion from a fuel tank in Jigawa resulted in at least 140 fatalities and numerous injuries, with the death toll expected to rise. This incident was triggered by a road accident involving a fuel tanker. Such explosions are common in Nigeria, where residents often attempt to collect fuel from accident sites amid a severe economic crisis.
